parameters: \pop[2]I slowly make my way toward The Wayfarer, passing the Town Square.
\pop[2]There's a large gathering of zeros, simply standing there. Some carry signs.
\pop[2]The protest was in full swing, and their cause surely had some numbers behind it.
\pop[2]If that's how many people were on a colony, then those things must be huge.
\pop[2]Without realizing it, I make eye contact with a family of \c[10]zeros\c[0].
\pop[2]I shake my head, slightly embarrassed at the unintentional staring.
\pop[2]They smile at me, and I choose to smile back.
\pop[2]At least they weren't weirded out by what I just did.
\pop[2]They hand their child an apple. Afer taking it, they start skipping around the town square.
\pop[2]They're holding a doll in their other hand. It has a smile just as wide as them.
\pop[2]But not nearly as wide as the parents who watch their child enjoy the city.
\pop[2]I guess that they were fighting not only for themselves, but for the future of every \c[10]zero\c[0].
\pop[2]After skipping and jumping around the town square, the child stops and looks at me.
\pop[2]I wave at them, and they wave back, before returning to their parents.
\pop[2]As they embrace each other, I take this as my signal to leave.
\pop[2]But I leave with a rising hope that they get what they want...
\pop[2]I round the corner and see The Wayfarer almost immediately.
\pop[2]As soon as I do, I see my friends standing around the entrance.
\pop[2]Just like Taylor said at the Triple R. Fashionably late, like always.
\pop[2]Isaac is knelt down, tinkering with what appears to be a drone.
\pop[2]The gang watches him work, and I can't help but feel concerned.
\pop[2]Messing with a drone mere moments before we sneak in Kyron?
\pop[2]This \c[14]had\c[0] to be related to everything going on.
\pop[2]As soon as I reach my friends, I make a noise, like I'm clearing my throat.
\pop[2]This instantly gets their attention, and hugs are exchanged.
I was just showing everybody what I've been up to.
Figured I could start without you, since I kinda talked about it at the diner.
\pop[2]That's true, he definitely gave me a crash course at the diner.
\pop[2]Or in this case, crash may not be the best word to use.
\pop[2]I know he can control them, and they run on his code.
\pop[3]I wish he didn't have to do it out in the open, though.
Correct me if I'm wrong, but Isaac looks pretty suspicious right now.
\pop[4]But the security on these things is top-notch.
If he was doing something wrong, then alarms would be blaring.
I've seen people look over, and they don't seem to care.
If I didn't work for \c[23]Argus\c[0], it'd be red.
\pop[4]And not only that, but it'd call for help.
We'd be surrounded by more drones, and they'd record us.
That's only until the \c[23]Argus\c[0] agents arrived to arrest us, of course.
\pop[4]Oh, I'm changing the patrol route on this drone.
Gonna have it watch the area while we're inside.
You know, just in case anything happens tonight.
Like, did something happen at your interview?
Even got invited back for a second one.
\pop[4]Yup! And you were all worried for nothing.
But it's good to know we're safe.
\pop[3]I think he meant to say congratulations.
\pop[2]Isaac stands up and grabs a piece of paper from his pocket.
\pop[2]Without missing a beat, he hands it over to Dante.
\pop[3]This is just a piece of paper that says "my words".
\pop[4]Yeah, you can go ahead and eat them now.
Can't believe you doubted me, man.
\pop[2]They look at me and Klace for backup, and we just shrug.
\pop[2]Isaac has stuck to his word, and delivered exactly what he promised.
\pop[2]If I were Taylor or Dante, this would be a turning point in how I felt.
\pop[4]Yeah, and I plan to keep it that way.
I can check again during my follow-up interview.
It's not scheduled yet, since New Year's Eve is so close.
\pop[2]With a smirk, he lets go of the drone, and stands up.
\pop[2]It immediately flies off, sticking to whatever route he planned.
\pop[2]It's impressive to see him do this. He really is a genius when it comes to tech.
\pop[4]Besides, they're super busy with the whole \c[10]Cipher\c[0] and \c[10]Hermes\c[0] thing.
I'm surprised they even had \c[14]time\c[0] for an interview, given the situation.
\pop[3]Yeah, I guess we picked the perfect time to do all this stuff.
When you say it the other way, I feel like an accomplice.
But before you can cut in with some snark, I have a question.
What did you do at the interview, Isaac? To check if we're safe, I mean.
This actually goes all the way back to our nightclub outing.
You know, when Dante dropped those bottles on the street.
\pop[3]So much for never mentioning it again.
\pop[4]I should thank you for it, actually.
It gave me the perfect opportunity.
\pop[4]Yep. Sure enough, a drone came by to clean it up.
But since litter is illegal, it had to look up street-cam footage.
That's the first thing they do. Try to find out who's responsible.
\pop[4]I knew that there'd be no data on Kyron, which is bad.
It'd immediately flag him as a \c[10]zero\c[0], and get us in trouble.
I rushed to create his identity, and even uploaded facial data.
\pop[4]Yeah. It scanned our faces, and looked for a match in the database.
Because I was fast enough, it was able to find Kyron's as well.
So we \c[14]may\c[0] be guilty of litter, but nothing more. I promise.
\pop[4]Yeah. And it was easy to look into during my interview.
When I was at their HQ, all I had to do was pull up the incident report.
If we were in trouble, there'd be notation, or the case would be escalated.
\pop[4]Nope. It was marked "closed" by an \c[23]Argus\c[0] agent.
Just something about drunk friends having a good time.
All of our names are clear in \c[23]The System\c[0]. Trust me.
\pop[2]I wondered why he was just standing there.
\pop[4]Now I know why you wanted all those photos of me after the nightclub.
Too bad. Thought maybe you came back outside to ask me on a date.
\pop[2]He laughs, trying to signal that it was a joke.
\pop[2]At least now I know what Isaac did when he went back outside that night.
\pop[4]And sorry for not being too talkative.
All this city talk goes \c[14]right\c[0] above my head.
At least I know what those flying things are now.
\pop[2]He must be talking about the drones.
\pop[2]I guess these topics would be pretty intimidating for him.
\pop[2]I can't even imagine the culture shock of entering the city walls.
\pop[4]Well, I don't think we'll need to talk about that stuff anymore.
Taylor and Dante just wanted me to put their minds at ease.
\pop[3]Definitely made a lot of progress, yeah.
\pop[3]I'm good to go. Feel a lot safer, too.
\pop[2]It's true. I could tell that the tension in the air was fading away.
\pop[2]It helps to know that we're truly under the radar, and without suspicion.
\pop[2]Especially as tensions rise and \c[23]Argus\c[0] presence increases in the city.
\pop[4]Well, I'm just as happy as them to leave this stuff behind.
And if we're safe, maybe I can even come to New Year's Eve.
\pop[4]It's starting to look more and more hopeful.
But let's focus on tonight. We still need to get you inside.
\pop[4]Yeah. But it can't be all of us.
Some of us should enter from the front door at the same time.
If anything, just to make sure that the door guy is occupied.
\pop[3]Well, I'm pretty sure I speak for all of us, here.
But this was your idea, so you need to do the dirty work.
\pop[3]Yeah. We'll all go in the front.
You two can sneak in the back.
But we'll save a table, so don't worry.
\pop[4]Sorry Isaac, but I feel the same way.
I can't risk getting caught as much as you can.
I just imagined a bit more teamwork.
\pop[3]We're causing a distraction for you, Isaac.
If they have to ID all of us, you'll have more time.
Maybe \c[14]you\c[0] should be the one saving a table for \c[14]us\c[0]?
\pop[2]Isaac shrugs and nods, realizing Taylor is right.
\pop[2]This was a team effort, and our entrance bought time for Isaac.
\pop[2]I look over at Kyron, and see a hint of worry remaining on his face.
\pop[4]What should we do if people start to suspect me? Or report me?
You know, just thinking worse case scenario.
\pop[4]Maybe we should have some sort of code word?
Something to tip each other off, but not make a scene?
\pop[3]Maybe we could say we're in the mood for vodka?
We can use that as the code word.
I could even sing to cause a distraction.
\pop[3]Yeah. Loaded with a ton of songs, too.
Maybe you can sing one of your own, Klace.
\pop[3]Perfect. If we need a distraction in the bar, Klace can get on stage.
But what do we do? Just make our way back home?
What if they send out agents or drones to catch us?
But I doubt it'll ever come to that.
The scans should work just fine. But I \c[14]am\c[0] prepared.
\pop[2]Isaac waves his phone in front of us, with a smirk.
\pop[4]I can pull up a live-map to help us avoid any drones.
If we need to, we'll make it back home without a trace.
Is that good? Can we go inside and party now...?
\pop[2]Everyone looks at each other, and nods.
\pop[2]It seems like we had an entry plan, and several exit plans.
\pop[2]No matter what happened, we'd be prepared to take on the night.
\pop[2]I'm a bit worried about potentially leaving Klace behind while he sings...
\pop[2]But the more I think about it, the more I think he'd be okay.
\pop[2]\c[23]Argus\c[0] wouldn't make a move on an idol while they're performing.
\pop[2]I just hope that things went smoothly.
\pop[2]It was good to be cautious, up to a point.
\pop[2]After a while, you're just overly paranoid.
\pop[2]Thankfully, Isaac dealt a big blow to any paranoia.
\pop[2]Even Dante seemed ready to party, which was saying something.
\pop[2]And so, we head inside, our bond feeling as strong as ever.
\pop[2]I just hope it stayed that way...
